name: hardwood forestry, eucalyptus ssp., planted forest management | cleft timber, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20587/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of eucalyptus wood fuel (fresh matter) from planted forest management as the prevailing management practices in a region that concentrates wood for energy purposes production in Brazil. Assumed wood basic density of 529 kg.m³-1. The actitivity lasts 14 years with 2 harvesting events. MAI is 42 m³/ha.year-1 in the first harvest and 38 m³/ha.year-1 in the second, resulting in a total of 562 m³.ha-1. Final moisture content of storage is 30%. The total amount of mineral fertilizers (N-P-K) and pesticides (glyphosate, sulfluramide,  isoxaflutole, flumioxazine and 2.4 D) apllied are 155 kg N.ha-1; 75 kg P2O5.ha-1; 345 kg K2O.ha-1 and 8,17 kg pesticides.ha-1, respectively. Specie mainly cultivated is E. urophylla, in a rate of 1666 seedlings.hectare-1.;References:;Canals, 2003: Contributions to LCA Methodology for Agricultural Systems. Site-dependency and soil degradation impact assessment: http://www.tdx.cat/handle/10803/3155;Nemecek & Schnetzer: Methods of assessment of direct field emissions for LCIs of agricultural production systems, Data v3.0 (2011): http://www.ecoinvent.org/fileadmin/talkpages/pages/01-01-crop-production/01_crop_production_-_direct_field_emissions___natural_resources_v1.1.pdf;MATSUURA, M. I. S. F; PICOLI, J. F.; NOVAES, R. M. L.; DIAS, F. R. T.; HIRAKURI, M. H.; CASTRO, C.; ZORTEA, R. B. Workbook for life cycle inventories of agricultural products. Jaguariúna. Empresa Brasileira de Pesquisa Agropecuária, 2017.;Novais & Smyth (1999) Fósforo em solo e planta em condições tropicais. Viçosa: Universidade Federal de Viçosa, p. 399.;SISTEMA CNA-SENAR (2016). Available in (http://www.cnabrasil.org.br/campo-futuro), acessed in 31 jul 2017.;QUIRINO, Waldir F.; VALE, Ailton Teixeira do; ANDRADE, Ana Paula Abreu de; ABREU, Vera Lúcia Silva; AZEVEDO, Ana Cristina dos Santos. Poder calorífico da madeira e de materiais lignocelulósicos. Revista da Madeira, n. 89, p. 100-106, 2005.;Novaes, Renan M. L. et al. (2016) Estimating 20-year land use change and derived CO2 emissions associated with crops, parture and forestry in Brazil and each of its 27 states. Global Change Biology, 2017, 1-13.;Nemecek T., Bengoa X., Lansche J., Mouron  P., Riedener E., Rossi V. & Humbert S. (2015) Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products. Version 3.0, July 2015. World Food LCA Database (WFLDB). Quantis and Agroscope, Lausanne and Zurich, Switzerland.

Activity starts with road grader and forestry mulcher, followed by the establishment of the eucalyptus plantation in the first year. After, covers the maintenance during six years and the first harvesting in the seventh. Eucalyptus sprouts are conducted to regrowth and the same process is repited.
Operations cover all activities of forest management, planting, fertilising, weed and ant control and harvesting operations. 

The processing of wood is not performed as the final product are logs for energy. Due to lack of data this dataset does not cover the maintenance and construction of forest roads and firebreaks.
This activity ends with the logs at the forest road and includes time for drying in air before transportation. The dataset does not include the seedling production.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/021:Silviculture and other forestry activities/0210:Silviculture and other forestry activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period of the most of the data collected for this dataset.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the state of Goiás, in Brazil.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of wood to generate energy inside industries, specially drying of grains. Machines used in the harvesting step are: chainsaw to fell trees, tractor coupled to a trailer auto loadable to extract the wood from the field to the forest boarder and forestry loader to load the transportation vehicle.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Carbon content is based on ecoinvent database.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The main source of data for forestry inputs and operations is the project "Projeto Campo Futuro" developed by SISTEMA CNA-SENAR in 2016. Data are also provided by relevant experts related to forestry sector of Eucalyptus wood for energy in Goiás (GO). 
Emissions from the agricultural process are estimated according to Nemecek and Schnetzer (2011) and Canals (2003).
The system of Eucalyptus production analyzed corresponds to the city of Cristalina in Goiás state.

exchanges.description: 1 kg of dry mass, including bark. The total yield is 561,97 m³.ha-1 with a final moisture content at storage of 30%.

exchanges.description:
"All pesticides applied for crop production were assumed to end up as emissions to the soil. The amounts of pesticides used as inputs were thus simultaneously calculated as outputs (emissions to agricultural soil)", as recomended by Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011), "2.9 EMISSIONS OF PESTICIDES TO AGRICULTURAL SOIL" (page 21).
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

flow.name: 2,4-D
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/agricultural

exchanges.description: Emissions of CO2 to air from limestone application.

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Emissions of heavy metals to soil and surface water estimated from mineral fertilisers and liming as recommended by Canals (2003). Due to lack of data about metal content in wood, it was considered zero absorption.
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

flow.name: Cadmium II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/forestry

exchanges.description:
Emissions of heavy metals to soil and surface water estimated from mineral fertilisers and liming as recommended by Canals (2003), metal content in wood from Freddo et al. (1999). According to the authors, there is 0,195 mg Ni/kg wood in a similar product.
Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011) state that "some of the values for emissions of heavy metals to the soil are negative. This means that more heavy metals are exported than imported. It must, however, be borne in mind that these heavy metals are transferred either to the water bodies or to the products harvested from the field".
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

flow.name: Nickel II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Emissions of heavy metals to soil and surface water estimated from mineral fertilisers and liming as recommended by Canals (2003), metal content in wood from Andrade et al. (2011). According to the authors, there is 46 mg Zn/kg wood in a similar product. 
Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011) state that "some of the values for emissions of heavy metals to the soil are negative. This means that more heavy metals are exported than imported. It must, however, be borne in mind that these heavy metals are transferred either to the water bodies or to the products harvested from the field".
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

flow.name: Zinc II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to soil/forestry

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0012 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Potassium chloride as source of K2O. K2O is applied through NPK-fertilizer and was converted using the NPK formulation. Amount for typical system from Folegatti et al. (2016). 
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

exchanges.description:
Emissions of heavy metals to soil and surface water estimated from mineral fertilisers and liming as recommended by Canals (2003). It was considered copper absorption in wood. According to Andrade et al. (2011), there is 10 mg Cu/kg wood in a similar product.
Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011) state that "some of the values for emissions of heavy metals to the soil are negative. This means that more heavy metals are exported than imported. It must, however, be borne in mind that these heavy metals are transferred either to the water bodies or to the products harvested from the field".
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

exchanges.description: Due to phosphorus low mobility in Brazilian soils, its emissions through leaching and run-off were disregarded (Novais & Smyth, 1999). Only P emission by water erosion through surface water was considered. They are calculated through the showed mathematical relation that is in accordance with "2.3.3 Phorsphorous Emissions Through Water Erosion to Surface Water" Nemecek and Schnetzer (2011).

Nemecek & Schnetzer (2011) state that "some of the values for emissions of heavy metals to the soil are negative. This means that more heavy metals are exported than imported. It must, however, be borne in mind that these heavy metals are transferred either to the water bodies or to the products harvested from the field".
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).

exchanges.description:
Emissions of heavy metals to soil and surface water estimated from mineral fertilisers and liming as recommended by Canals (2003). Due to lack of data about metal content in wood, it was considered zero absorption.
Original values per ha were attributed to total volume of wood produced per hectare (changing the reference product from ha to m3) and to density (changing the reference product from m3 to kg).
